translated: Therefore, at that time and so forth are easy to understand.

original: de ltar lta ba dang spyod pa dag la bram ze zhes bya'i /
analyzed: de ltar lta ba dang spyod pa dag la bram ze zhes bya'i /
translated: Thus, one is called a Brahmin in terms of view and conduct,

analyzed: rigs la sogs pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir gcer bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
translated: but not in terms of caste and so forth.

analyzed: lam phyin ci ma log pa dang ldan na rigs la mi ltos par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that if one possesses the unmistaken path, one does not depend on caste,

original: dman pa'i rigs su skyes kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dman pa'i rigs su skyes kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is said, Even if born in an inferior caste.

original: 'khrul pa'i dbang gis rtag tu 'khor ba de las bzlog par gdams pa ni /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i dbang gis rtag tu 'khor ba de las bzlog par gdams pa ni /
translated: In order to advise that one should turn away from samsara, which is always due to the power of delusion,

original: yang dang yang du zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug bsdus te gdams pa /
analyzed: yang dang yang du zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug bsdus te gdams pa /
translated: it is summarized with again and again and so forth.

analyzed: kva'i zhes bos nas sems khyod rang gis rang gi dri ma khrus //
translated: Having addressed the mind, it is said, You should wash your own stains.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, face means the face of the mind.

original: bzhin gyi dri ma me long la bltas nas sel ba ltar /
analyzed: bzhin gyi dri ma me long la bltas nas sel ba ltar /
translated: Just as one removes the dirt on one's face by looking in a mirror,

original: me long dang 'dra ba'i bla ma dang / chu dang 'dra ba'i man ngag gis ma rig pa'i dri mas gang gos pa de zad par bya'o //
analyzed: me long dang 'dra ba'i bla ma dang / chu dang 'dra ba'i man ngag gis ma rig pa'i dri mas gang gos pa de zad par bya'o //
translated: so one should remove the dirt of ignorance by means of the guru, who is like a mirror, and the instructions, which are like water.

analyzed: de'i phyir bla ma'i man ngag gi chus rtog pa'i dri ma bkru bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should wash away the dirt of conceptual thought with the water of the guru's instructions.

original: tshul ji ltar bkru zhe na /
analyzed: tshul ji ltar bkru zhe na /
translated: How should one wash?

original: sems khyod yongs su go bar gyis la rang la ni //
analyzed: sems khyod yongs su go bar gyis la rang la ni //
translated: Mind, understand this thoroughly, and look within yourself!

original: yongs su blta zhing gti mug mun pa chen po sbyongs //
analyzed: yongs su blta zhing gti mug mun pa chen po sbyongs //
translated: Cleanse the great darkness of delusion!üîΩHere, mind means the mind that is the basis of all.

analyzed: zhes bya ba la chos thams cad sems dang rlung gi rnam par 'phrul bar go bar gyis la rang la rang ste /
translated: One should understand that all phenomena are the magical display of mind and wind, and look within oneself, which means to look at the nature of the wind and mind.

original: rlung dang sems rang bzhin la bcug la nam mkha' dang 'dra bar ltos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rlung dang sems rang bzhin la bcug la nam mkha' dang 'dra bar ltos zhes bya'o //
translated: One should look at the nature of the wind and mind, which is like space.

original: de lta bu'i thub pa'i chos kyi gtam mi nyan pa dang / de'i skal ba med pa ni me ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i thub pa'i chos kyi gtam mi nyan pa dang / de'i skal ba med pa ni me ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: Those who do not listen to the Muni's Dharma talk in this way, and those who are not fortunate enough for it, are like those who are burned by fire.

original: de bas na nges par 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro dgos pa yid la byas la /
analyzed: de bas na nges par 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro dgos pa yid la byas la /
translated: Therefore, one should keep in mind that one must certainly go to the next world.

original: thub pa'i chos kyi gtam byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa mnyan zhing goms par bya'o //
analyzed: thub pa'i chos kyi gtam byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa mnyan zhing goms par bya'o //
translated: One should listen to and become familiar with the Dharma talk of the Sage, such as the thought of awakening.

original: de thos nas de dang 'gal ba'i las mi bya ste mnar med par 'gro ba la de min pa gang gis kyang 'dzin par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thos nas de dang 'gal ba'i las mi bya ste mnar med par 'gro ba la de min pa gang gis kyang 'dzin par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having heard that, one should not do actions that are contrary to it, because nothing else can hold one back from going to Avƒ´ci Hell.

analyzed: de thos nas de ltar de sbyangs nas gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu mtho ris la /
translated: Having heard that, having trained in that way, the temporary result is rebirth in the higher realms.

original: mthar thug gi 'bras bu byang chub 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug gi 'bras bu byang chub 'thob pa'o //
translated: The ultimate result is the attainment of awakening.

translated: The Dharma is the lamp for the darkness of ignorance, because it illuminates the natural luminosity of going for refuge, the thought of awakening, and so on, up to the final great bliss samƒÅdhi.

translated: Therefore, it liberates from the great ocean of existence.

translated: Therefore, one should definitely rely on and become familiar with the boat and the guide.
